intro: Crotalaria uncinata, commonly known as the hooked crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a herbaceous annual that produces distinctive yellow flowers with spurred petals. The plant has palmate leaves with three to five leaflets, and its seed pods are elongated and contain spiny seeds. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or bean family. Crotalaria uncinata is often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in certain environments.
